result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rosendo Segundo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rosendo Segundo in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 13CF361 and 14CF333.  Parties state Waiver of Preliminary was held prior and an Information being filed today on 14CF333 State files an information.  Defendant stands Mute and Court enters a Not Guilty plea on that case as it will be DRI in the sentencing agreement for 13CF361.
Parties have received and reviewed the PSI report, PTSP report and Compas updated Report.  ADA Cousins makes sentencing recommendation for 14CF361 counts 1 & 4: Count 1: W/H sentence: 30 mo Probation with 6 mo conditional jail.  
Ct 4: $150 fine + costs.
Atty Kessler concurs with agreements and requests electronic monitor.
Defendant makes statements to the Court about the PTSP program and how it has helped him.

BTC: ********************PROBATION******************  
Ct 1: 346.63(1)(a) OWI 4th w/5yr - Felony: W/H Sentence:  30 months Probation:
Condtions: 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations from assessment he has already had.
Submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Reimburse County for Attorney fees and any monies on file will be applied.  
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.  
Must sign release form for all treatment providers and pharmacy.
Conditional Jail Sentence:  6 mo Jail with huber for counseling and work.   Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date. Continue in the Pre-Trial Supervision Program (PTSP) until his sentence is completed.  First 90 days in jail and balance 90 days on electronic monitor if incompliance with PTSP program.
Pretrial incarceration credit: 4 days 
Pay fine:  $1,200 fine + costs. Fines/costs are due and payable while on probation.
$26.45 Blood draw costs.
33 months Revocation
33 months IID - today

Ct 4: 343.44(1)(b) OAR: $150 fine + costs. zero day jail and zero days suspension

14CF333 is Dismissed Read In.
Status conference on September 16, 2014 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued
Court kept the file as matter may be heard as an arraignment tomorrow.

Defendant Rosendo Segundo in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on September 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rosendo Segundo in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant indicates he has Atty Kessler who was appointed on his other cases by the Court. 

Court advises defendant to contact Atty Kessler. 

Court will set this matter for next Monday to allow for Atty Kessler to appear. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued. 
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $1,000 signature bond.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: 9/8/14 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
